scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-695 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-695 is a star with 0.84 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.8 times its radius. It is located 2749.32 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 4.47 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

Kepler-695 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-695 system


Kepler-695 b

Kepler-695 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory, in 2016-05, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-695 b is 62.328 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-695 b is 9.210 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-695 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-695, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Kepler.
name: Kepler-695 - System With 1 Exoplanet
